metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000001 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
In glibc 2.26 and earlier there is confusion in the usage of getcwd() byrealpath() which can be used to write before the destination buffer leadingto a buffer underflow and potential code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

musl - 0.9.15-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
musl-tools - 0.9.15-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.14').
musl package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.15-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
